Name: Relief of Horhotep
Description: This low-relief shows Horhotep, Priest of Buto, seated on the left on a chair that has lion's paws. He is wearing a short wig and a short kilt and is holding a long rod in his left hand; his right hand rests on his knee. His name and titles are written from right to left in a vertical column in front of him. Horhotep is receiving offerings from eight men and women, who have brought their children. They are presenting him with calves, birds, geese, jars, baskets of fruit, various types of plants, and lotus.
